Police are tracking down a scam offering discounts on outstanding Tenaga Nasional Berhad (TNB) bill payments, which has so far seen seven cases reporting losses of RM280,000.

Director of the Bukit Aman Commercial Crime Investigation Department (JSJK) Datuk Seri Ramli Mohamed Yoosuf said the syndicate was offering the service with a discount of 20% to 30% through Facebook where victims would call a telephone number before sending a photo of the outstanding bill.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 6): Police are tracking down a scam offering discounts on outstanding Tenaga Nasional Berhad (TNB) bill payments, which has so far seen seven cases reporting losses of RM280,000.

Director of the Bukit Aman Commercial Crime Investigation Department (JSJK) Datuk Seri Ramli Mohamed Yoosuf said the syndicate was offering the service with a discount of 20% to 30% through Facebook where victims would call a telephone number before sending a photo of the outstanding bill.

content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Sept 6): Malaysia’s traditional media companies will likely trudge against sustained headwinds on consumer sentiment and advertising spending despite recent improvements, Kenanga Investment Bank warned.
